channel.title: Help please!
channel.description: Hi, i'm just about to put my client up for download but i need help with somthing first. Ok, I have no-ip set up, have a source and a client. But my client connects to my source when no-ip is closed. Should it do this? And what files exactly do i need to change so that when other people download my client, they can connect to my no-ip and my source. I NEED AN ANSWER ASAP PLEASE!

item.title: Help please!
item.dc:creator: @life_lover7 life lover7
item.description:
@life_lover7 wrote:

I’m still able to connect to the server without no-ip duc even running. I think somthing’s still local host. Somone helppp[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 08, 2009, 08:04:32 pm[/size][hr]can somone help? ps.there’s no server.java in my client folder…just client.java.

Read full topic

item.title: Help please!
item.dc:creator: @staticfish1 staticfish1
item.description:
@staticfish1 wrote:

Copy all of them and upload. If someone downloads and opens it and changes something it wont affect yours (the original) so theres no need to take files out.

Hope I helped

Read full topic

item.title: Help please!
item.dc:creator: @life_lover7 life lover7
item.description:
@life_lover7 wrote:

Ok thanks, and files exactly do i need to include in the client when i upload it?what files do i need to leave in my client folder when i upload onto mediafire?

Read full topic

item.title: Help please!
item.dc:creator: @staticfish1 staticfish1
item.description:
@staticfish1 wrote:

Go into your server.java in you client folder. Search for whatever your sources name is.

Ctrl+f
examplescape.no-ip.biz (change to your ip)

Or search in Client.java
examplescape.no-ip.biz (change to your IP)

Now in your source files in client.java go to edit-replace and put in the sources name.
Example:
Replace: Deltascape
Replace With: examplescape.no-ip.biz

Read full topic
